translated: Verses of the Elders
The Fives
The First Chapter🔽Nadīkassapa

analyzed: atthāya vata me buddhaḥ  nadim nerañjaram agāḥ
translated: The Buddha came to the river Nerañjara for my sake,
having heard the Dhamma from him
I abandoned wrong view.
I made offerings in various sacrifices,
I offered oblations into the fire,
thinking ‘this is purification,’
the worldling is blind.
I was entangled in the thicket of views,
deluded by grasping,
I thought impurity was purity,
blind, I did not see.
Wrong view has been abandoned by me,
all existences have been shattered,
I offer oblations into the fire of the worthy one,
I pay homage to the Realised One.

analyzed: mohā sabbe pahīnā me  bhava taṇhā padālitā
translated: All delusion has been abandoned by me,🔽craving for existence has been shattered,
The round of births has been exhausted,
there is no continuation in existence.”
… the Elder Nadīkassapa …
